alert.note: Alert for Baraga; Gogebic; Houghton; Iron; Keweenaw; Marquette; Ontonagon; Southern Houghton (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 20 at 3:30PM EST until February 23 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Long duration snow event with two rounds of heavier snow. Snow accumulations in excess of 6 inches possible Monday and Monday evening. Snow accumulations in excess of 6 inches possible Tuesday and Tuesday night. Northeast winds will result in the highest amounts across the highlands of Marquette, Baraga, Ontonagon, and Gogebic Counties. Lowest amounts are expected across southern Iron County, southern Marquette county, the immediate Marquette County lakeshore and parts of the Keweenaw. * WHERE...Portions of central Upper and western Upper Michigan...mainly along and north of M 28. * WHEN...From Monday morning into Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning and evening commutes Monday through Wednesday morning. The cold wind chills as low as 15 below zero could result in hypothermia if precautions are not taken. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...This will be a long duration snow event. The heaviest snow will occur from Monday afternoon into early Monday evening and again Tuesday afternoon into Tuesday evening. Winds could gust as high as 30 mph, especially Tuesday afternoon and evening creating blowing snow.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
